text: (gentle music)
- My name is Azza El-Shinnawy,
I'm the Head of Egypt.
And what brought me into AWS is, in fact,
I decided to resign from my previous job
and treat myself to a full year gap.
I was approached a couple of months
into this gap year by AWS.
And then I studied a lot for the interview

and versed myself into
the AWS technologies.
Once I was offered the job,
I found that I was terribly ill.

I told the hiring manager
at that point in time,

"Please feel free to hire
another candidate for the role."

But the feedback was, "No,
AWS will wait for you."

My role as Country Head
of Egypt is actually

to be one with the national
priorities of the country.
So looking and working backwards
from the national priorities of Egypt,
how AWS wants to support the government,

either onboard, progress, or
advance on the cloud journey.

And it is very genuine
and with no exaggeration,

that the national priorities
of Egypt are, in fact,

the national priorities
of AWS and of my team.
(lively music)
